title: Joan Marcus
text:
Joan Marcus is a theatrical photographer based in <a href="Manhattan">Manhattan</a>, New York City, United States.
Marcus, originally from <a href="Pittsburgh">Pittsburgh</a>, was educated at <a href="George%20Washington%20University">George Washington University</a> in Washington, D.C. She has been active as a theatrical photographer in Washington, D.C. and New York City for most of her career. Starting in 1986, she has been a photographer on Broadway theatre productions, covering over a hundred shows including "<a href="Wicked%20%28musical%29">Wicked</a>", "<a href="The%20Lion%20King%20%28musical%29">The Lion King</a>", "<a href="Sister%20Act%20%28musical%29">SisterAct</a>", and "<a href="The%20Book%20of%20Mormon%20%28musical%29">The Book of Mormon</a>". She is considered to be "one of the preeminent Broadway photographers."
Joan Marcus is married to the theatrical press agent <a href="Adrian%20Bryan-Brown">Adrian Bryan-Brown</a> of <a href="Boneau/Bryan-Brown">Boneau/Bryan-Brown</a>, a leading theatrical press agency. They are both involved with Broadway theatre and have been included in "The 10 Greatest Broadway Couples of All Time".
In 2014, Joan Marcus was awarded a "Tony Honor for Excellence in the Theatre" at the New York Broadway <a href="Tony%20Award">Tony Award</a>s.
